intro: Commelina rzedowskii, commonly known as the Rzedowski's spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
